issue.title: QR claim system enhacements
issue.body:
## What we did?

1. Claim QR system enhanced to allow `on-process` claim status on database
2. New status management from dApp client
3. Tx update in local and development environments
4. Added bump transaction status on Tx

issue.title: Token image endpoint
issue.body:
## What we did?
Created a new endpoint `/token/:tokenId/image` to obtain the token image in a simple way.
This was made to allow integration of POAP Badges to Etherscan

issue.title: POAP Backend enhancements
issue.body:
## What we did?
This PR includes:

1. QR Claim security measures improvements
2. Dynamic Address selection based on balance
3. Fix on Gas Estimations
4. Env variables clean-up to make it easier to use different hosts (local networks, testnets, mainnet)
5. Event badges images moved to server

issue.title: Migrate images to server
issue.body:
This PR adds all of the event's badge images to the `/website/public/events/badges/ `folder.
all migrated images have their names set to `{fancy-id}.{extension}`
Note that the event with id 30 does not have a fancy-id so it could not be migrated with a valid name.

In order to update the database to point to the new images, the following sql sentences should be executed:
https://gist.github.com/frandelgado/2ef83f3ef05f2057942eff044eaa939c

The script used to generate the images and the migration file can be found at:
https://gist.github.com/frandelgado/ed14f2ce83cbb935f7cbb8be17355078

issue.title: DEVCON - New claim system
issue.body: ## What we did? We implemented a new claim system to allow users to claim their POAP badges. This included several changes in the back-office to allow mutiple wallets to mint tokens, and a block monitor tu update transactions status. ## Deployment intructions - Run migrations on database - Add new minter wallets to admin roles - Deploy back-office gae - Deploy dApp ## Screenshots ### New claim page ### Claiming token for an event ### Token claimed

issue.title: Fix on tokens creation for missing IDs and adding minting tests
issue.body: ## Description - It was noticed that as tokens were minted, the ID didn't increment as expected. As a result, several tokens IDs were not used. Below a screenshot of Etherscan that highlights the missing IDs. ## What was the problem? After testing the `Poap.sol` contract we identified that the missing IDs were appearing as batch minting methods were called. We could quickly identify that the methods `mintEventToManyUsers` and `mintUserToManyEvents` were adding an extra token to the `lastId` variable that keeps track of the last token's ID minted. ## Other comments We also included some test for the token minting methods, so that we could test that the bug was fixed. Individual tests for each minting method are included in this PR, and also an integration one that tests all methods sequentially and validates the correct creation of the tokens.

issue.title: dApp enhancements
issue.body:
This PR includes:

1. Gas Price administration
2. Token burn section for admins
3. ENS UI enhancements on dApp
4. Built on Ethereum logo
